data.snapshot: A fast liquidity sweep (~7.6% drop) occurred during the week, grabbing stops before the partial recovery.
chronology: Early week: rejections at supply zones.
Midweek: liquidity sweep and elevated sells.

scenarios.title: Bearish continuation (most likely)
scenarios.text: Fail to reclaim resistance → rollover → break support → test lower bands.

scenarios.title: Range / chop (plausible)
scenarios.text: Price oscillates as macro events & flows decide the next leg.

scenarios.title: Bullish recovery (lower probability)
scenarios.text: Sustained daily strength above resistance with volume → retest higher levels.

scenarios.title: Event risk
scenarios.text: Macro prints and expiries can amplify intraday moves; avoid heavy sizing around these.

checklist: For demand zone longs: wait for a bullish reaction candle + above‑average buy volume; stop under sweep low.
For structured shorts: wait for a retest of resistance that fails and shows rejection volume; reduce size into expiries.
If price closes daily above key resistance with volume, reconsider bearish sizing.
Keep position sizing modest — the structure is still corrective and volatile.
